items.headline: Nvidia’s OpenAI deal adds to a brewing concern. But will that actually hurt the stock?
items.summary_en: An analyst notes some investors are increasingly worried that Nvidia is investing in companies that then purchase its chips. But he also notes the demand landscape looks strong for now.
items.next_en: Next: watch scheduled data (CPI/Jobs/Fed) or company guidance.

items.headline: Jimmy Kimmel supporters who pushed for Disney boycott take victory lap over his Tuesday return to ABC
items.summary_en: Proponents of a boycott of the Walt Disney Co. over its decision to pull Jimmy Kimmel’s show last week after pressure from the White House took a victory lap on Monday after the company decided to return the late-night host to the air.
items.next_en: Next: watch scheduled data (CPI/Jobs/Fed) or company guidance.

items.headline: This new fund backed by the legendary Bill Miller banks on a simple but winning formula
items.summary_en: Veteran money manager Joseph Shaposhnik has a plan to fix actively managed funds and a track record on delivery.
items.next_en: Next: watch scheduled data (CPI/Jobs/Fed) or company guidance.

items.headline: ‘I cannot plan our life’: My boyfriend, 54, has $90K in credit-card debt. How can we buy a house together now?
items.summary_en: “I’m on track to retire in 10 years.”
items.next_en: Next: watch scheduled data (CPI/Jobs/Fed) or company guidance.

items.headline: The OECD lifts U.S. growth outlook — but it’s still a bleak forecast
items.summary_en: The Organization of Economic Cooperation and Development expects the U.S. economy to slow dramatically this year, though its new forecast is slightly more upbeat than one offered earlier in the year.
items.next_en: Next: watch scheduled data (CPI/Jobs/Fed) or company guidance.

items.headline: I’m 88 and leaving my $450,000 estate to my son because he has children. Is that wrong?
items.summary_en: “My other children have relationships, but they are unmarried and have no children.”
items.next_en: Next: watch scheduled data (CPI/Jobs/Fed) or company guidance.

items.headline: ‘I want to live in a place that I can enjoy’: I’m 69, single and get $3,000 in Social Security. Can I afford $2,000 rent?
items.summary_en: “With inheritance, I now have a little over $1 million in cash and investments.”
items.next_en: Next: watch scheduled data (CPI/Jobs/Fed) or company guidance.

items.headline: ‘I changed my will to deter vultures’: I’m in my 60s and disabled. Do I impoverish myself to qualify for Medicaid?
items.summary_en: “I pay my taxes and insurance, donate money and personal belongings.”
items.next_en: Next: watch scheduled data (CPI/Jobs/Fed) or company guidance.

items.headline: I’m 67. My wife, 48, is financially illiterate. How do I teach her to manage our money? After all, I won’t be around forever.
items.summary_en: “We have a 12-year-old daughter. I have $1.1 million in a traditional IRA and $250,000 in cash.”
items.next_en: Next: watch scheduled data (CPI/Jobs/Fed) or company guidance.

items.headline: ‘I am mentally stuck’: My daughter has a financially reckless spouse. How do I protect her?
items.summary_en: “I am afraid they will end up destitute and homeless.”
